Description: Lower body sherd from North Ionian pottery vessel. Interior reserved; exterior slipped cream: two friezes separated by band with added red band lined in white: above, perhaps legs of an animal to right and half-rosette fill; below, rays. Post-firing graffito on outside.
Curator's comments: The relatively thin wall suggests this may be from an oenochoe rather than a larger vase, but it could also be from a lid. Half rosettes are normally, though not always, pendant, not rising from the floor; if this were a lid the frieze would face inwards, which is unusual, but the graffito would be far more visible than one cut low on the wall.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.429)
